definition:
For a commutative ring $R$ having regular elements, we may form
$T = S^{-1}R$, the [*total ring of fractions*]{} (quotients) of $R$, as
the localization of $R$ at $S$, where $S$ is the set of all
non-zero-divisors of $R$. Then, $T$ can be regarded as an extension ring
of $R$ (similarly as the field of fractions of an integral domain is an
extension ring). $T$ has the non-zero unity 1.
